issues.description: The UML diagram in the problem statement defines the abstract Animal class with two attributes (name:String and age:int), but the solution implementation (and implied template) only declares a single String name attribute and omits age. This mismatch between the specification and the code can confuse students about whether to include and manage the age field.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a private int age field to Animal.java, include it in the constructor, and provide corresponding getAge() and setAge(int) methods to match the UML specification.

issues.description: The UML diagram specifies an Animal constructor with signature Animal(String, int), but the solution defines only Animal(String). This constructor‚Äêparameter mismatch prevents students from following the UML and may lead to confusion about how to initialize all declared attributes.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the Animal constructor to take two parameters (String name, int age) and initialize both fields accordingly, matching the UML diagram.
